Function.Description: The isImmediate function returns true if the value stored in the Object Repository is saved as an immediate value in the Repository Index.

Brief.Overview: The isImmediate function returns the Boolean value true if the value associated with the specified index {index} is stored in the specified ObjectRepository {aGor} as an immediate value in the Repository Index (see the saveImmediate function).
Brief.Usage: The isImmediate function checks if the index value associated with the object is succesfully stored.

Argument.Name: index
Argument.Note: The index value associated with the object.

Syntax.Return: This function returns the Boolean value true if the value with the specified index is succesfully stored.
